thread.section_title: Palm Beach County High School Sports - Sun Sentinel
thread.title: Boca crushes Lake Worth, improves to 7-0
thread.title_full: Boca crushes Lake Worth, improves to 7-0 - Sun Sentinel

author: Steve Dorsey
title: Boca crushes Lake Worth, improves to 7-0
text:
Philip Santiago passed for three touchdowns and Bryce Hill rushed for 146 yards and a score to lead unbeaten Boca Raton past Lake Worth 31-7 on Friday.
Boca Raton (7-0) runs its District 10-8A record to 4-0 and moves closer to a much anticipated showdown against rival Atlantic in two weeks, but Bobcats coach Eric Davis said he's not looking that far ahead.
"We don't use the 'A' word," Davis said. "We don't live in a time capsule, but we know we have a target on our chest."
Lake Worth (4-4, 1-3) appeared poised for an upset, as the Trojans trailed only 14-7 at haltime. But Santiago and the Boca Raton offense made some adjustments at halftime and pulled away for the win, which gives the Bobcats their best start since the 2008 team was 7-0.
Hill was a workhorse in the backfield, lugging the football 29 of Boca Raton's 35 running plays. He culminated his night with a 5-yard touchdown run on the Bobcats' final possession of the game.
"The offensive line did a great job and opened up the running game in the second half," Davis said.
Santiago threw touchdown passes of 30 yards and 4 yards to Jeremy Reynolds and Shermar Moore, respectively, in the first half and connected on a 5-yard touchdown toss to Xavier Morley in the third quarter that gave Boca Raton a 21-7 lead.
Gabe Bravo kicked a 33-yard field goal to account for Boca Raton's other points.
Danny Montero caught a 7-yard touchdown pass from Chris Nazien for Lake Worth's only touchdown. The Trojans were limited to 126 yards total offense by Boca Raton's defense, which also forced two turnovers.
